main event: A ground-visual observation of a white, parallelepiped object, roughly the size of a quarter, moving at a slow, steady pace over Marlboro, New York in August 1958. The observation lasted for 3 minutes.
interesting points: The object was described as white, parallelepiped (a three-dimensional figure with six faces, each of which is a parallelogram) and the size of a quarter.
The source of the report was ATIC (Air Technical Intelligence Center).
The object was observed moving at a slow, steady pace, possibly indicating controlled movement.
Erratic movements and random movements of the same phenomena were noted to be missing, suggesting a lack of correlation with typical searchlight behavior.
The observation lasted for 3 minutes, providing a significant duration for detailed analysis.
